content: And let the nations gain their strength;
Let them come near, then let them speak;
Let us come together for judgment [and decide the issue between us concerning the enemy from the east].
“Who has stirred up  put into action one from the east [the king of Persia, Cyrus the Great]
Whom He calls in righteousness to His service  whom victory meets at every step?
The  turns nations over to him
He makes them like dust with his sword,
Like wind-driven chaff with his bow.
“He (Cyrus) pursues them and passes along safely,
By a way his feet had not traveled before.
Calling forth [and guiding the destinies of] the generations [of the nations] from the beginning?
‘I, the —the first, and with the last [existing before history began, the ever-present, unchanging God]—I am He.’”
